revised_title: Description of a Unique Species of Chameleon
tldr: The author describes a unique species of chameleon with a distinct head structure and finger arrangement. The chameleon has a large head with unique processes and a skin covered in tubercles and scales. Its fingers are long and have pointed nails, with a different arrangement in the front and back extremities. The chameleon's spine has rows of knobs, and it lacks auditory holes.
